Course Description and Objectives
392 Documentary Production, Th 10-12:50
In this course, students will examine documentary practices and produce their own short. The emphasis will be on watching and critiquing what students generate, as well as screening and discussing clips from influential documentary filmmakers. By looking at examples by filmmakers such as Werner Herzog, Errol Morris, and Jehane Noujaim, students will wrestle with: What kinds of documentaries are relevant today? What are the ethical obligations of a documentarian? How do budgetary restrictions determine stylistic choice? How does stylistic choice interact with content? What are traditional versus alternate/emerging possibilities for financing and exhibition?

Requirements include: A series of written exercises, a series of production exercises, and a finished 8 to 10 minute documentary.

Pre-Reqs:
RTVF 190
Class cap 15

Learning Objectives
What will the student be expected to know by the end of the class? Student is expected to gain a deeper understanding of the documentary genre and be able to employ a variety of filmmaking tools to create their own short documentary.
